resources.string: View Gyroscope Data Instead of TouchScreen Sensor Data

Touch blank space and move your finger for screen sensor readings (not all phones support them). Put the phone on a hard surface and click the button for vibration. During vibration, touchscreen sensor readings are disabled. Note: placing your finger at different locations during vibration, even with the same amount of force, can have dramatically different effects on the gyroscope readings. It is recommended that you place your finger at the center of the phone screen to measure the relative pressure your finger applies to the screen during vibration.
Place your phone on a hard surface.
You are now required to place an object of known weight at the CENTER of the phone screen. Please input the weight of the object below.
Do not place any objects on the phone.
You will see concentric circles at the center of the phone screen. This is where you will place your object.
Click the button to vibrate the phone.
Wait 5 seconds for the vibration to stop.
Calibration complete. Click the button to continue to the next step.
Place your index finger, middle finger, and ring finger on the center of the phone screen.
The phone will vibrate for 5 seconds.
The phone will vibrate for 20 seconds.

With the help of the other hand, unfold your bad hand. Place your index finger, middle finger, ring finger, and pinky finger of the bad hand on the center of the phone screen like what is shown in the picture below. The palm of the bad hand must stay on the table. Then, use the "good" hand to click on the "vibrate" button. When the phone starts vibrating, try the best to lift the fingers (without help from the other hand) so that they do not touch the screen.
